edu.cnm.deepdive.security

Class WordList

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.security.WordList

  • public class WordList
extends java.lang.Object
    Gets a random subset of words from a list.
    Author:
    Sky Link

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_NUM_WORDS
      The default value used for the phrase length, if none is specified.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_NUM_WORDS

        public static final int DEFAULT_NUM_WORDS
        The default value used for the phrase length, if none is specified.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • WordList

        public WordList()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Loads a file and selects a subset of random words to print out. The number of words in the subset is determined by the command line argument. If no arguments are specified, DEFAULT_NUM_WORDS is used.
        Parameters:
        args - Specifies the number of words to be used in the phrase.

      • getWordList

        public static java.lang.String[] getWordList(java.lang.String listPath)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the word list from a text file specified as an argument.
        Parameters:
        listPath - Takes the file path to the list text file as a String.
        Returns:
        Returns the word list text file as a String Array.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Happens when word list can't be read.

      • getRandomWords

        public static java.lang.String[] getRandomWords(int numWords,
                                                java.lang.String[] wordList)
        Takes a list of words and returns a random subset of that list of the specified size.
        Parameters:
        numWords - The number of words desired for the random phrase.
        wordList - A list of words in the form of a String Array.
        Returns:
        Returns another String Array that is a random subset of the second argument.
